Question: How to create a txt file in Java?: :I'm just want a program to register a user and then create a txt file to store there the information. I know it has to be with createNewFile method but I do not know how to use it. I'd try this in my code:import java.util.*;public class File{public static void main(String args[]){    Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);byte option=0;    do{        System.out.println("\nMENU:\n");        System.out.println("0.-EXIT");        System.out.println("1.-REGISTER USER");        System.out.println("\nPLEASE ENTER YOUR CHOICE:");        option = sc.nextByte();    }while(option!=0);}//main}//File
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer: <<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class File {
    public static void main(String args[]) {
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        byte option = 0;
        do {
            System.out.println("\nMENU:\n");
            System.out.println("0.-EXIT");
            System.out.println("1.-REGISTER USER");
            System.out.println("\nPLEASE ENTER YOUR CHOICE:");
            option = sc.nextByte();

            if (option == 1) {
                System.out.println("Enter your name:");
                String name = sc.next();
                System.out.println("Enter your age:");
                int age = sc.nextInt();

                try {
                    FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("user.txt", true);
                    PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
                    printWriter.println(name + ", " + age);
                    printWriter.close();

                    System.out.println("User registered successfully!");
                } catch (IOException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }
        } while (option != 0);
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The code first creates a new FileWriter object that will write to the file "user.txt". The second parameter of the FileWriter constructor is a boolean that determines whether to append the data or to overwrite it. If we set it to true, the data will be appended to the file. Then, a PrintWriter object is created using the FileWriter object. The PrintWriter object has a println method that writes a line to the file. After writing the data, the PrintWriter is closed. If an IOException occurs during this process, it is caught and its stack trace is printed.

Please note that this code will overwrite the file each time a user is registered. If you want to append the data to the file instead of overwriting it, you should set the second parameter of the FileWriter constructor to false or to use the FileWriter constructor without a second parameter, which defaults to false.
